Edited by Jennifer E. Neal for compliance with DACS and ACM Required Elements for Archival Description
New York University Archives
Institute of International Finance, Press Clippings
Institute of International Finance
MC 79
0.25 Linear Feet in one half manuscript box
1927-1971 1927-1939 The Investment Bankers Association of America, in cooperation with New York University, founded the Institute of International Finance in 1926 as a fact-finding body concerned with foreign economic and financial conditions. This collection contains a scrapbook of press clippings that mention the Institute of International Finance from between 1927 and 1939 and "The Bulletins of NYU's Institute of Finance, 1926-1970: A Review Article," reprinted from the Journal of Economic Literature. Materials primarily in English. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown.
Historical Note
The Investment Bankers Association of America, in cooperation with New York University, founded the Institute of International Finance in 1926 as a fact-finding body concerned with foreign economic and financial conditions. John T. Madden, the Dean of New York University's School of Commerce, Accounts, and Finance directed the Institute. The Institute published Bulletins, answered inquiries, developed a finance library, and published studies about foreign economic conditions.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Institute of International Finance, Press Clippings; MC 79; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
Processing decisions made prior to December 2018 were not recorded.
Scope and Contents
This collection includes a scrapbook that contains clippings from various sources including news organizations, newspapers, and pamphlets, from between 1927 and 1939 that mention the Institute of International Finance. Each item is labeled with its source and date. "The Bulletins of NYU's Institute of Finance, 1926-1970: A Review Article," by Samuel Katz, reprinted from the Journal of Economic Literature, is in the same box as the scrapbook.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Arrangement
Materials are arranged by format.
Journals (periodicals) Scrapbooks. Bulletins. New York University. Graduate School of Business Administration Madden, John T. (John Thomas) Investment Bankers Association of America
